sap.gantt.legend.LegendContainer.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.LegendContainer}.
The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page legend sections are Page controls.

getLegendSections.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getLegendSections legendSections}.

This aggregation specifies the title of a legend section. When you add the legend section to a legend navigation container, you must specify a title for the legend section so that the section can be identified in the initial navigation list. Otherwise, your legend section is not reachable via GUI.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

parameters.oLegendSection: type: sap.m.Page, description: The legendSection to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears. Default value is "200px".

When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "200px".

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property height

Default value is "200px".

getNavigationPage.!description: Returns the control instance of List Control for the initial navigation page

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears. Default value is "200px".

sap.gantt.legend.LegendContainer.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new legend container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "200px")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: "200px")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLegendSections legendSections} : sap.m.Page[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.legend.LegendContainer.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.LegendContainer}.
The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page legend sections are Page controls.

removeLegendSection.!description: Removes a legendSection from the aggregation {@link #getLegendSections legendSections}.
removeLegendSection.!type: fn(vLegendSection: Number | String | sap.m.Page) -> sap.m.Page | null

parameters.vLegendSection: type: int|string|sap.m.Page, description: The legendSection to remove or its index or id

getCurrentLegendSection.!description: Returns the currently displayed legend section. If no legend section is added, this function returns the initial navigation page.

getNavigationItems.!description: Returns the navigation items in the initial navigation list

insertLegendSection.!description: Inserts a legendSection into the aggregation {@link #getLegendSections legendSections}.

parameters.oLegendSection: type: sap.m.Page, description: The legendSection to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the legendSection should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the legendSection is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the legendSection is inserted at the last position

sap.gantt.axistime.StepwiseZoomStrategy.!description: The class allows you to define a zoom strategy whose time line options are stepwise, i.e. the width of each time line option is pre-defined and won't be changed during zooming.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.axistime.StepwiseZoomStrategy.

setTotalHorizon.!description: Sets the total horizon of StepwiseZoomStrategy. The time range and view range of this.getAxisTime() will also be updated, the rate will remain unchanged.

parameters.oTotalHorizon: type: object, description: total horizon of StepwiseZoomStrategy

setTimeLineOptions.!description: Sets the time line options of StepwiseZoomStrategy.

parameters.oTimeLineOptions: type: object, description: time line options of StepwiseZoomStrategy

sap.gantt.axistime.StepwiseZoomStrategy.!constructorDescription: Constructor for a new StepwiseZoomStrategy. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategyBase#constructor sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategyBase} can be used.
sap.gantt.axistime.StepwiseZoomStrategy.!helpDescription: The class allows you to define a zoom strategy whose time line options are stepwise, i.e. the width of each time line option is pre-defined and won't be changed during zooming.

setZoomLevels.!description: Don't use this method to set zoomLevels because its value is determined by timeLineOptions. The account of entities in timeLineOptions is zoomLevels.

parameters.iZoomLevels: type: int, description: zoom levels of StepwiseZoomStrategy

updateStopInfo.!description: This method does below things: 1. Sets time line option according to the stop info object. 2. Sets zoom level according to the stop info object. The setter of zoom level does some additional things.

parameters.oStopInfo: type: object, description: Zoom stop information, which contains the parameters key and text.

setFinestTimeLineOption.!description: Don't use this method to set finestTimeLineOption because its value is determined by timeLineOptions. The first entry of timeLineOptions is finestTimeLineOption.

parameters.oTimeLineOption: type: object, description: finest time line option of StepwiseZoomStrategy

getTotalHorizon.!description: Return total horizon time. The value will be changed according to zoom level, and is not same as the value user set.

setCoarsestTimeLineOption.!description: Don't use this method to set coarsestTimeLineOption because its value is determined by timeLineOptions. The last entry of timeLineOptions is coarsestTimeLineOption.

parameters.oTimeLineOption: type: object, description: coarsest time line option of StepwiseZoomStrategy

setVisibleHorizon.!description: Sets the visible horizon of StepwiseZoomStrategy. Don't use this method to set visible horizon because its value is determined by zoomLevel or timeLineoption.

parameters.oVisibleHorizon: type: object, description: visible horizon of StepwiseZoomStrategy

sap.gantt.config.BirdEyeRange.!description: Define the range of data that bird eye would use to calculate visibleHorizon

AllRows.!description: Bird eye will calculate visibleHorizon based on all rows of current view, but this mode may cause low performance. Using this bird eye range, the result is not influenced by vertical scroll bar position as the total rows never changes.

VisibleRows.!description: Bird eye will calculate visibleHorizon based on row data only in visible rows. Using this bird eye range, the result can be influenced by vertical scroll bar position as visible rows may change with the movement of the vertical scroll bar position.

Description of the Delta Line

getResizable.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getResizable resizable}. Specifies whether the delta line is resizable. Default value is false.

getDraggable.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDraggable draggable}. Specifies whether the delta line is draggable. Default value is false.

sap.gantt.simple.DeltaLine.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new DeltaLine class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_3_BorderColor")
    • {@link #get_strokeWidth _strokeWidth} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStrokeDasharray strokeDasharray} : string
    • {@link #getStrokeOpacity strokeOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getTimeStamp timeStamp} : string
    • {@link #getEndTimeStamp endTimeStamp} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVisibleDeltaStartEndLines visibleDeltaStartEndLines} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTimeDelay timeDelay} : int (default: 300)
    • {@link #getDraggable draggable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getResizable resizable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight _enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #get_isSelected _isSelected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_level _level} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #get_visibleMarker _visibleMarker} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseEnter mouseEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseLeave mouseLeave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deltalineDrop deltalineDrop} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:deltalineResize deltalineResize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

setStrokeOpacity.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStrokeOpacity strokeOpacity}. Standard SVG 'stroke-opacity' attribute. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

parameters.fStrokeOpacity: type: float, description: New value for property strokeOpacity

detachMouseEnter.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:mouseEnter mouseEnter} event of this sap.gantt.simple.DeltaLine. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachMouseEnter.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.gantt.simple.DeltaLine

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

detachMouseLeave.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:mouseLeave mouseLeave} event of this sap.gantt.simple.DeltaLine. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachMouseLeave.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.gantt.simple.DeltaLine

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

getTimeDelay.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.97 Note:With the new implementation, this property won't have any effect.
Gets current value of property {@link #getTimeDelay timeDelay}. Visibility of the Delta Line Default value is 300.

setTimeDelay.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.97 Note:With the new implementation, this property won't have any effect.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getTimeDelay timeDelay}. Visibility of the Delta Line When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 300.

parameters.iTimeDelay: type: int, description: New value for property timeDelay

setStroke.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStroke stroke}. Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. You can provide the stroke attribute with HTML colors and URL reference to the paint server. Paint server definitions usually come from paint servers rendered by {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer}, {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable} or {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_3_BorderColor".

parameters.sStroke: type: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer, description: New value for property stroke

Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
Pentangle shape class using SVG tag 'polygon'. It's usually treated as a transient shape.

Following SVG image shows how the properties are designed:

getRadius2.!description:
Gets the value of property radius2.

The second radius of a pentangle shape. If this property is not provided, radius2 is set to a value making radius and radius2 fit the golden ratio. This property influences property points.

sap.gantt.shape.ext.Pentangle.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
Pentangle shape class using SVG tag 'polygon'. It's usually treated as a transient shape.

Following SVG image shows how the properties are designed:

getPoints.!description:
Gets the value of property d.

points attribute of the polygon element. Your application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of d by using properties radius and radus2. The value of these properties can be retrieved using the corresponding getters (getRadius and getRadius2). If your application overwrites the value of d by configuration or code, accurate results cannot be guaranteed.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.AdhocLine.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.84 {@link sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine} should be used instead.
The AdhocLine class contains properties to draw an additional vertical line at specific time points in the chart area. You can use this line to mark milestones, such as the start of a project start, and special events, such as holidays.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.AdhocLine.

getStroke.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getStroke stroke}.

Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. You can provide the stroke attribute with HTML colors and the URL reference to the paint server. Paint server definitions usually come from paint servers rendered by {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer}, {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable} or {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}.

parameters.fStrokeWidth: type: float, description: New value for property strokeWidth

Gets current value of property {@link #getStrokeDasharray strokeDasharray}.

Standard SVG 'stroke-dasharray' attribute.

sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs.!description:
The class handles the container tag "defs" for all reusable SVG graphic definitions. It provides interfaces for SVG definition strings and referencing strings. The parent class is responsible for rendering the definition strings.

SVG uses the 'defs' tag to represent graphic objects that are defined for reuse at a later time. Currently sap.gantt provides defs including the following definition tags: 'pattern', 'gradient', and 'filter'. Applications can also extend this base class to support more functionality.

This shape is used to represent an invisible rectangle with tooltips. Note that a tooltip appears only when the title tag is specified on the rectangle.

Graphic Effect is:

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcTooltipRectangle.

getWidth.!description:
Gets the value of property width.

Width of a rectangle. Your application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the width by using property start_date and property end_date. If your application overwrites the getter by configuration or code, accurate results cannot be guaranteed.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

The default value is 0.

Creates and initializes a new Time horizon Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStartTime startTime} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getEndTime endTime} : string (default: undefined)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

parameters.oTimeHorizon: type: undefined, description: Time horizon to compare.

setEndTime.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEndTime endTime}. End time of the time horizon in this format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS. If the type of endTime is Object, the value is converted to a string. Note: Modifying this property does not invalidate the control. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is undefined.

parameters.sEndTime: type: string, description: New value for property endTime

getStartTime.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStartTime startTime}. Start time of the time horizon in this format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS. sap.gantt.axistime.FullScreenStrategy.!description:
FullScreenStrategy

A zoom strategy that sets the value of totalHorizon to the value of visibleHorizon. When this strategy is implemented, visibleHorizon is fixed. Because of this, when you scroll the splitter to expand or shrink the chart area, the value of visibleHorizon remains intact, which makes shapes look larger or smaller accordingly. Moreover, the horizontal scroll bar never appears and the zoom control is deactivated.

FullScreenStrategy

A zoom strategy that sets the value of totalHorizon to the value of visibleHorizon. When this strategy is implemented, visibleHorizon is fixed. Because of this, when you scroll the splitter to expand or shrink the chart area, the value of visibleHorizon remains intact, which makes shapes look larger or smaller accordingly. Moreover, the horizontal scroll bar never appears and the zoom control is deactivated.

Group shape class using SVG tag 'group'. It is a container shape. Any other shapes can be aggregated under a group.

genReferenceId.!description:
Generate a referenceId according to shape data.

'referenceId' is used to identify Definitions shapes. Aggregation shapes of a Group shape can retrieve the 'referenceId' by their getParentReferenceId method and then consume the corresponding Definition shape.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

indexOfShape.!description: Checks for the provided sap.gantt.shape.Shape in the aggregation {@link #getShapes shapes}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oShape: type: sap.gantt.shape.Shape, description: The shape whose index is looked for

insertShape.!description: Inserts a shape into the aggregation {@link #getShapes shapes}.

parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the shape should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the shape is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the shape is inserted at the last position
parameters.oShape: type: sap.gantt.shape.Shape, description: The shape to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

addShape.!description: Adds some shape to the aggregation {@link #getShapes shapes}.

getTag.!description: Gets the value of the tag property. SVG tag name of the shape. Note: We do not recommend that you change this value using a configuration or coding.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

parameters.oRowObjectInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

sap.gantt.shape.Group.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Group class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: "g")
    • {@link #getRLSAnchors RLSAnchors} : object
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getShapes shapes} : sap.gantt.shape.Shape[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.

destroyShapes.!description: Destroys all the shapes in the aggregation {@link #getShapes shapes}.

sap.gantt.shape.Group.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseGroup}.
Group shape class using SVG tag 'group'. It is a container shape. Any other shapes can be aggregated under a group.

setTag.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTag tag}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "g".

parameters.sTag: type: string, description: New value for property tag

removeAllShapes.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getShapes shapes}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

parameters.oRLSAnchors: type: object, description: New value for property RLSAnchors

sap.gantt.def.gradient.Stop.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a gradient stop defined for later reuse. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getOffSet offSet} : string (default: "5%")
    • {@link #getStopColor stopColor} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_ContrastLineColor")
    • {@link #getStopOpacity stopOpacity} : float (default: 1)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.def.DefBase#constructor sap.gantt.def.DefBase} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.simple.StockChartDimension.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Stock Chart Dimension Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getDimensionPathColor dimensionPathColor} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor")
    • {@link #getRemainCapacityColor remainCapacityColor} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_Neutral_Plus1")
    • {@link #getRemainCapacityColorNegative remainCapacityColorNegative} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_Bad_Plus1")
    • {@link #getRelativePoint relativePoint} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getIsThreshold isThreshold} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDimensionStrokeDasharray dimensionStrokeDasharray} : string
    • {@link #getDimensionStrokeWidth dimensionStrokeWidth} : float (default: 2)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getStockChartPeriods stockChartPeriods} : sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getStockChartPeriods.!description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getStockChartPeriods stockChartPeriods}. Aggregation of periods are used to display the utilization line. The periods have to be in chronological order, you must ensure that it's sorted by from, otherwise the SC can't ben display correctly.

removeStockChartPeriod.!description: Removes a stockChartPeriod from the aggregation {@link #getStockChartPeriods stockChartPeriods}.
removeStockChartPeriod.!type: fn(vStockChartPeriod: Number | String | sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod) -> sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod | null

parameters.vStockChartPeriod: type: int|string|sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod, description: The stockChartPeriod to remove or its index or id

getDimensionStrokeDasharray.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDimensionStrokeDasharray dimensionStrokeDasharray}.

strokeDashArray value of dimension line.

removeAllStockChartPeriods.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getStockChartPeriods stockChartPeriods}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

insertStockChartPeriod.!description: Inserts a stockChartPeriod into the aggregation {@link #getStockChartPeriods stockChartPeriods}.

parameters.oStockChartPeriod: type: sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod, description: The stockChartPeriod to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the stockChartPeriod should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the stockChartPeriod is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the stockChartPeriod is inserted at the last position

    • {@link #getActiveModeKey activeModeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_MODE_KEY)

parameters.sActiveModeKey: type: string, description: New value for property activeModeKey

sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcDimension.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
This shape is a container for {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcBorderPath}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverClipRectangle}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcUnderClipRectangle}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipPath}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipingPath}.

For each dimension, it has two colors, one is OverCapacity and the other is UnderCapacity. When the UlcClipPath of a dimension and UlcOverClipRectangle overlap, which means the utilization rate is above 100%, the overlapped part will be colored by OverCapacity. The overlapped part of UlcClipPath and UlcUnderClipRectangle is colored by UnderCapacity.

UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath. UlcClipingPath and UlcBorderPath share the same value of property 'd'. UlcBorderPath is used to visualize the dimension line.

parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
This shape is a container for {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcBorderPath}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverClipRectangle}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcUnderClipRectangle}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipPath}, {@link sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipingPath}.

For each dimension, it has two colors, one is OverCapacity and the other is UnderCapacity. When the UlcClipPath of a dimension and UlcOverClipRectangle overlap, which means the utilization rate is above 100%, the overlapped part will be colored by OverCapacity. The overlapped part of UlcClipPath and UlcUnderClipRectangle is colored by UnderCapacity.

UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath. UlcClipingPath and UlcBorderPath share the same value of property 'd'. UlcBorderPath is used to visualize the dimension line.

parameters.sX: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property x

getWidth.!description: Gets the value of property width. Width of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using properties time and endTime

parameters.sRy: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property ry

getHeight.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}.

Height defines the vertical length of the rectangle.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseDeltaRectangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new BaseDeltaRectangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getX x} : sap.gantt.SVGLength
    • {@link #getY y} : sap.gantt.SVGLength
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.gantt.SVGLength
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength
    • {@link #getRx rx} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: 0)
    • {@link #getRy ry} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: 0)
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getShowTitle showTitle} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_3_BorderColor")
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseEnter mouseEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseLeave mouseLeave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

Time intervals to be skipped for the day.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.skipTime.DayInterval.

destroySkipIntervals.!description: Destroys all the skipIntervals in the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}.

removeAllSkipIntervals.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

addSkipInterval.!description: Adds some skipInterval to the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}.

parameters.oSkipInterval: type: sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval, description: The skipInterval to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getDay.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDay day}.

Non-working day, supported values: "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", "Sunday"

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.skipTime.DayInterval with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend}.

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.gantt.skipTime.DayInterval.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new class for day interval. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDay day} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals} : sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.skipTime.DayInterval.!helpDescription: Enables the user to define skip time pattern within a day.

removeSkipInterval.!description: Removes a skipInterval from the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}.
removeSkipInterval.!type: fn(vSkipInterval: Number | String | sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval) -> sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval | null

parameters.vSkipInterval: type: int|string|sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval, description: The skipInterval to remove or its index or id

setDay.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDay day}. Non-working day, supported values: "Monday", "Tuesday", "Wednesday", "Thursday", "Friday", "Saturday", "Sunday" When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sDay: type: string, description: New value for property day

insertSkipInterval.!description: Inserts a skipInterval into the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}.

parameters.oSkipInterval: type: sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval, description: The skipInterval to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the skipInterval should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the skipInterval is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the skipInterval is inserted at the last position

indexOfSkipInterval.!description: Checks for the provided sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval in the aggregation {@link #getSkipIntervals skipIntervals}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oSkipInterval: type: sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval, description: The skipInterval whose index is looked for

sap.gantt.shape.Shape.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape}.
Base class for all shape classes.

Shape class is designed to describe how data should be visualized by an SVG tag. Most shape classes contain only properties and only one aggregation:

  • Some properties come from standard SVG attribute. Examples are fill, stroke etc.
  • Some properties designed to put Shape class into Gantt chart's coordinate system, especially the X axis called sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime. Examples are time, endTime etc.
  • Some properties are designed to provide some geometry attributes. Examples are side, center in some extend shapes.
  • Every shape has aggregation called selectedShape to provide a way to specify how selection of the shape should be designed.
  • Some container shapes like g and clippath has aggregation to aggregate other shapes in.
Because d3 is used underneath and d3 use array to do batch data-binding, therefore Shape classes are not designed in the way of SAPUI5 standard data-binding (one shape instance per data). Instead, each Shape instance stands for a particular way of visualize one data structure. And one Shape instance is used to draw a list of data by Drawers in Gantt chart. Because of this specialty, application cannot instantiate a shape class directly. Instead they can use configuration {@link sap.gantt.config.Shape} to describe which Shape class is used to draw which data in what way. And pass this configuration to Gantt chart control by property shapes. Gantt chart control use these configurations to instatiate Shape instances and Drawers. Drawers consumes Shape instances to draw real SVG shapes. Each shape classes are designed to support 'configuration-first' principle. So called configure is the shapeProperties property of sap.gantt.config.Shape. In this object property, application can provide following things:
  • A value. Example: {tooltip: 'svg rocks'}.
  • An attribute from data. Example: {time: {startTime}}
  • A formatted attribute from data. Example: {tooltip: "{time:Timestamp} the stock price falls to {price:Number}."} The typed numeric values for the key number are formatted by the configurations provided by {@link sap.ui.core.format.NumberFormat}, and the date and time values for the key timestamp are formatted by the configurations provided by {@link sap.gantt.misc.Format}.
In many applications, simple configuration or even binding cannot meet business requriement. Therefore applications are allowed to extend shapes and provide their own getter methods to effect all properties by data. For in row shapes, two parameters are injected to help application to do coding. All the shapes provided by Gantt chart follows 'configuration first' principle by invoking method _configFirst(). Meaning if application provide value by sap.gantt.config.Shape, the configuration over-write code logic in getters. Note: Setter methods are only used for set default values. Because a Shape instance stands for a way of drawing. The instance self does not hold any status (property values). Meanwhile, all getter are injected with actual data and related informations to adapt to d3 paradigm.

sap.gantt.shape.Shape.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape}.
Base class for all shape classes.

  • Some properties come from standard SVG attribute. Examples are fill, stroke etc.
  • Some properties designed to put Shape class into Gantt chart's coordinate system, especially the X axis called sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime. Examples are time, endTime etc.
  • Some properties are designed to provide some geometry attributes. Examples are side, center in some extend shapes.
  • Every shape has aggregation called selectedShape to provide a way to specify how selection of the shape should be designed.
  • Some container shapes like g and clippath has aggregation to aggregate other shapes in.
Because d3 is used underneath and d3 use array to do batch data-binding, therefore Shape classes are not designed in the way of SAPUI5 standard data-binding (one shape instance per data). Instead, each Shape instance stands for a particular way of visualize one data structure. And one Shape instance is used to draw a list of data by Drawers in Gantt chart. Because of this specialty, application cannot instantiate a shape class directly. Instead they can use configuration {@link sap.gantt.config.Shape} to describe which Shape class is used to draw which data in what way. And pass this configuration to Gantt chart control by property shapes. Gantt chart control use these configurations to instatiate Shape instances and Drawers. Drawers consumes Shape instances to draw real SVG shapes. Each shape classes are designed to support 'configuration-first' principle. So called configure is the shapeProperties property of sap.gantt.config.Shape. In this object property, application can provide following things:
  • A value. Example: {tooltip: 'svg rocks'}.
  • An attribute from data. Example: {time: {startTime}}
  • A formatted attribute from data. Example: {tooltip: "{time:Timestamp} the stock price falls to {price:Number}."} The typed numeric values for the key number are formatted by the configurations provided by {@link sap.ui.core.format.NumberFormat}, and the date and time values for the key timestamp are formatted by the configurations provided by {@link sap.gantt.misc.Format}.

Meaning if application provide value by sap.gantt.config.Shape, the configuration over-write code logic in getters. Note: Setter methods are only used for set default values. Because a Shape instance stands for a way of drawing. The instance self does not hold any status (property values). Meanwhile, all getter are injected with actual data and related informations to adapt to d3 paradigm.

getParentReferenceId.!description:
Retrieves the parent shape's referenceId.

The referenceId, which is related to shape data, is generated by a Group shape. Aggregation shapes can use this method to retrieve the referenceId.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

setEnableResize.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getEnableResize enableResize}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

parameters.bEnableResize: type: boolean, description: New value for property enableResize

getRotationCenter.!description:
Gets current value of property rotationCenter.

This value is used in combination of property rotationAngle. By providing both shape can be rotated with any angle around rotation center. Default implementation is the coordinate at time in x coordinate, and rowYCenter in y coordinate. If application over-write this property by configuration or code, the logic cannot be guaranteed.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

getStrokeWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property strokeWidth.

Standard SVG 'stroke-width' attribute.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

Specify which is time attribute of items in child array.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

getStroke.!description:
Gets current value of property stroke.

Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. Note: HTML color and url reference to paint server can be provided to stroke. Paint server definitions usually comes from paint servers rendered by {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer}, {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable} or {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

getXBias.!description:
Gets current value of property xBias.

Fine-tune x coordinate. This value only works for category inRowShape. Shape usually determines position in x coordinate by property isDuration, time and endTime. Application can use this property to do some x coordinate adjustment in pixel. The xBias will be automatically mirrored for RTL mode. It means if you set 10 to property xBias, in RTL mode, the value of the xBias will be -10.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information of the row and row data.

parameters.sStrokeDasharray: type: string, description: New value for property strokeDasharray

sap.gantt.shape.Shape.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Shape class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string
    • {@link #getCategory category} : string (default: library.shape.ShapeCategory.InRowShape)
    • {@link #getHtmlClass htmlClass} : string
    • {@link #getIsDuration isDuration} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTime time} : string
    • {@link #getEndTime endTime} : string
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getAriaLabel ariaLabel} : string
    • {@link #getXBias xBias} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getYBias yBias} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getFill fill} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
    • {@link #getStrokeOpacity strokeOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getFillOpacity fillOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : float (default: 0)
    • {@link #getStrokeDasharray strokeDasharray} : string
    • {@link #getClipPath clipPath} : string
    • {@link #getTransform transform} : string
    • {@link #getFilter filter} : string
    • {@link #getEnableHover enableHover} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableDnD enableDnD} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableSelection enableSelection} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableResize enableResize} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getRowYCenter rowYCenter} : float (default: 7.5)

When this flag is set to true, the shape is called 'duration shape'. And time stands for startTime, endTime stands for end time. When this flag is set to be false, the shape is called 'transient shape'. And only time is used. Usually these 3 properties are used to determine x position of one shape.

getIsBulk.!description:
Gets current value of property isBulk.

Gantt chart do filtering of data by timestamp for performance sake. For simple shapes which has time or endTime provided, set this flag to false. For shapes (path or polygon) which connect a list of data, set this value to false. And if filtering is required to next level data, provide arrayAttribute, timeFilterAttribute and endTimeFilterAttribute in combination.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar.!constructorDescription:
Creates a calendar shape that either consumes pattern from calendar in the 'def' package as the "calendarName" property is defined, or, it exists as any other instance of BasShape with defined relevant properties. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCalendarName calendarName} : string
    • {@link #getFill fill} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_Neutral_Plus2")
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_Neutral_BorderColor")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar.!helpDescription:
BaseCalendar shape.

The Calendar shape can either be used in combination with Calendar def class {@link sap.gantt.def.cal.Calendar} which draws the SVG 'defs' tag, or it can be used as a standalone shape with time and end time defined.

getCalendarName.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getCalendarName calendarName}.

Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions.

setCalendarName.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getCalendarName calendarName}. Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sCalendarName: type: string, description: New value for property calendarName

setStroke.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStroke stroke}. stroke for the calendar shape When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_Neutral_BorderColor".

parameters.sStroke: type: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer, description: New value for property stroke

sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcMiddleLine.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
This shape is used to draw a middle line, which indicates the position of 50%.

Graphic Effect is:

getY1.!description:
Gets the value of property y1.

y coordinate of the start of the line. At the top of each row, a certain amount of space (in the shape of a rectangular frame) is reserved for over capacity area. You can use 'maxVisibleRatio' in 'shapeConfig' to specify the amount of area to reserve. With the reserved area deducted from a row, the height of the middle line is set to 50% of the row height.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

Gets the value of property strokeWidth.

Standard SVG 'stroke-width' attribute.

The default value is 1.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart.!description:
Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions. Each Utilization dimension is represented by a line, you could define different colors for each dimension.

You can define the ULC background by property fill, the default background color is light gray

sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart.!helpDescription:
Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions. Each Utilization dimension is represented by a line, you could define different colors for each dimension.

You can define the ULC background by property fill, the default background color is light gray

sap.gantt.GenericArray.!description:
A hybrid data type that can represent an array of string, or array of object. The result value parsed by this data type are "string[]" or "object[]" Examples of valid values in js:
  1. ["order", "activity"]
  2. [{name:"order", idName:"OrderNo"},{name:"activity"}]
  3. [{name:"order", idName:"OrderNo"},"activity"]
Examples of valid values in xml view:
  1. "order,activity"
  2. "[order,activity]"
  3. [{"name":"order", "idName":"OrderNo"},{"name":"activity"}]
sap.gantt.GenericArray.!helpDescription:
A hybrid data type that can represent an array of string, or array of object. The result value parsed by this data type are "string[]" or "object[]" Examples of valid values in js:
  1. ["order", "activity"]
  2. [{name:"order", idName:"OrderNo"},{name:"activity"}]
  3. [{name:"order", idName:"OrderNo"},"activity"]
Examples of valid values in xml view:
  1. "order,activity"
  2. "[order,activity]"
  3. [{"name":"order", "idName":"OrderNo"},{"name":"activity"}]

sap.gantt.config.Hierarchy.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
Defines the hierarchy in the Gantt chart. The hierarchy is used for building the tree table in {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable}.

getKey.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getKey key}. Unique key of the hierarchy Default value is sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_HIERARCHY_KEY.

parameters.sColumns: type: object[], description: New value for property columns

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.config.Hierarchy.

getText.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getText text}. Description of the hierarchy Default value is "Default Hierarchy".

setExpandedLevels.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.46.8 This feature may cause severe performance issue! Since TreeTable doesn't have API to expand specific multiple rows in one call, GanttChart expand the tree tale to level calculated from the configuration, then loop all data in the model, collapse the node which does not full-fill the configuration one by one. This feature is application specific and should be handled by application.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getExpandedLevels expandedLevels}. expandedLevels determines how the tree table is initially expanded. This property is a two-dimensional array containing object types of row data. Only rows with data of the specified object types are expanded. Each child array represents a specific level in the hierarchy with the first child array representing the first level and so forth. For example, if this property is set to [["02", "03"], ["05"]], rows containing data of object types 02 or 03 in the first level and rows containing data of object type 05 in the second level are expanded. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sExpandedLevels: type: string[][], description: New value for property expandedLevels

getColumns.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getColumns columns}.

Columns of the hierarchy. Array of {@link sap.gantt.config.HierarchyColumn}

    • {@link #getActiveModeKey activeModeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_MODE_KEY)
    • {@link #getToolbarSchemeKey toolbarSchemeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_GANTTCHART_TOOLBAR_SCHEME_KEY)
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : object[]
    • {@link #getExpandedLevels expandedLevels} : string[][]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getExpandedLevels.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.46.8 This feature may cause severe performance issue! Since TreeTable doesn't have API to expand specific multiple rows in one call, GanttChart expand the tree tale to level calculated from the configuration, then loop all data in the model, collapse the node which does not full-fill the configuration one by one. This feature is application specific and should be handled by application.
Gets current value of property {@link #getExpandedLevels expandedLevels}. expandedLevels determines how the tree table is initially expanded. This property is a two-dimensional array containing object types of row data. Only rows with data of the specified object types are expanded. Each child array represents a specific level in the hierarchy with the first child array representing the first level and so forth. For example, if this property is set to [["02", "03"], ["05"]], rows containing data of object types 02 or 03 in the first level and rows containing data of object type 05 in the second level are expanded.

SemanticColors.!description:
Semantic colors:
  • sapUiNegativeText - Negative (warning)

sap.gantt.shape.!description:
The sap.gantt.shape namespace. This namespace provides the following configuration related features:
  • A base class sap.gantt.shape.Shape is provided directly in this namespace
  • A default selection shape class sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape is provided directly in this namespace
  • All basic shapes corresponding to SVG tag are provided directly in this namespace
  • Extended shapes from tag shapes are provided in sub-namespace ext
  • Special calendar shape, which should be used in combination with the calendar paint server, is provided in sub-namespacecal

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

svgDefs.!description: SVG reusable element definitions. If this property is provided, the paint server definition of SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed to this property.

yDimension.!description: Name of yDimension. Note that the Shape instance used in DimensionLegend must have a set of data matches this property's value. The data set contains entries specifying the representation of individual legend items.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

xDimension.!description: Name of xDimension. Note that the Shape instance used in DimensionLegend must have a set of data matches this property's value. The data set contains entries specifying the representation of individual legend items.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

shapes.!description: Shapes for legend items. These shapes are used in the Gantt chart.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

xDomain.!description: Valid values of xDimension. Each of these values has a corresponding entry in the data set that matches xDimension in the Shape instance.

height.!description: Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears.

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

shape.!description: A Shape instance that contains two sets of data, one for the 'x' dimension and the other for the 'y' dimension. The system determines the representation of a legend element according to its 'x' dimension and 'y' dimension values.

yDomain.!description: Valid values of yDimension. Each of these values has a corresponding entry in the data set that matches yDimension in the Shape instance.

width.!description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

fontSize.!description: Font size of legend item texts.

Enables users to visualize the relationship between elements.

Four types of relationships are supported and L-shaped lines are supported for the finish-to-start type.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.shape.ext.rls.Relationship.

getCategory.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCategory category}. Category name Default value is sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory.Relationship.

parameters.fArrowSideLength: type: float, description: New value for property arrowSideLength

setShowEnd.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowEnd showEnd}. Indicates whether the end point (arrow) of the relationship shape is visible When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bShowEnd: type: boolean, description: New value for property showEnd

setToObjectPath.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getToObjectPath toObjectPath}. Path of successor element When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sToObjectPath: type: string, description: New value for property toObjectPath

getHtmlClass.!description: Gets the CSS class of the relationship shape

parameters.oData: type: object, description: Raw data object

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

sap.gantt.shape.ext.rls.Relationship.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a Relationship object Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getHtmlClass htmlClass} : string (default: "relationshipLine")
    • {@link #getCategory category} : string (default: sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory.Relationship)
    • {@link #getIsClosed isClosed} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsDuration isDuration} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : string (default: "#000000")
    • {@link #getFill fill} : string (default: "#000000")
    • {@link #getType type} : sap.gantt.shape.ext.rls.RelationshipType (default: FinishToFinish)
    • {@link #getFromObjectPath fromObjectPath} : string
    • {@link #getFromExpandRowIndex fromExpandRowIndex} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getFromShapeId fromShapeId} : string
    • {@link #getFromDataId fromDataId} : string
    • {@link #getToObjectPath toObjectPath} : string
    • {@link #getToExpandRowIndex toExpandRowIndex} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getToShapeId toShapeId} : string
    • {@link #getToDataId toDataId} : string
    • {@link #getShowStart showStart} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowEnd showEnd} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLShapeforTypeFS lShapeforTypeFS} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMinXLen minXLen} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getArrowSideLength arrowSideLength} : float (default: 5)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSelectedShape selectedShape} : sap.gantt.shape.ext.rls.SelectedRelationship
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Path#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Path} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDefs.!description:
Calendar pattern definition. This class generates the 'defs' tag from the 'defs' aggregation.

Calendar (for non-working hours) is a widely used graphic element in a Gantt chart. Calendar is considered to be highly reusable between different rows of resources. A default implementation of patterns is provided. After calendars are rendered from def tags, shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar can be used to consume the calendar pattern definition. This class is extended to provide a specific logic for generating referencing strings for calendar patterns.

sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDefs.!helpDescription:
Calendar pattern definition. This class generates the 'defs' tag from the 'defs' aggregation.

Calendar (for non-working hours) is a widely used graphic element in a Gantt chart. Calendar is considered to be highly reusable between different rows of resources. A default implementation of patterns is provided. After calendars are rendered from def tags, shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar can be used to consume the calendar pattern definition. This class is extended to provide a specific logic for generating referencing strings for calendar patterns.

sap.gantt.def.pattern.BackSlashPattern.!description: Backslash pattern defined by a path. The stroke color and stroke width of the path can be modified with properties.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.def.pattern.BackSlashPattern.

getStroke.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStroke stroke}. Stroke color of the path element. Default value is "sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor".

setStrokeWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth}. Stroke width of the path element. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 2.

parameters.iStrokeWidth: type: int, description: New value for property strokeWidth

setPath.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPath path}. Value of the d attribute in Path element. The value is affected by property tileWidth and tileHeight. If this value is changed by coding, the effect is not guaranteed. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sPath: type: string, description: New value for property path

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.def.pattern.BackSlashPattern with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.gantt.def.pattern.PatternBase.extend}.

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

sap.gantt.def.pattern.BackSlashPattern.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a backslash pattern defined for later reuse. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPath path} : string
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor")
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : int (default: 2)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.def.pattern.PatternBase#constructor sap.gantt.def.pattern.PatternBase} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.def.pattern.BackSlashPattern.!helpDescription: Backslash pattern defined by a path. The stroke color and stroke width of the path can be modified with properties.

getPath.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPath path}. Value of the d attribute in Path element. The value is affected by property tileWidth and tileHeight. If this value is changed by coding, the effect is not guaranteed.

setStroke.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStroke stroke}. Stroke color of the path element. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor".

parameters.sStroke: type: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer, description: New value for property stroke

getStrokeWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth}. Stroke width of the path element. Default value is 2.

Creates and initializes a new hierarchy column Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

    • {@link #getContentType contentType} : string
    • {@link #getSortAttribute sortAttribute} : string
    • {@link #getFilterAttribute filterAttribute} : string
    • {@link #getAttribute attribute} : string
    • {@link #getAttributes attributes} : object[] (default: [])

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

It will be set to BaseChevron, BaseRectangle, BaseCursor BaseDiamond, BaseText, BaseTriangle and BaseGroup. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Middle.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.
