sap.gantt.config.ChartScheme.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new ChartScheme class Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getRowSpan rowSpan} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getIcon icon} : sap.ui.core.URI
    • {@link #getModeKey modeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_MODE_KEY)
    • {@link #getHaveBackground haveBackground} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getBackgroundClass backgroundClass} : string
    • {@link #getShapeKeys shapeKeys} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getRowIndexName rowIndexName} : string (default: "rowIndex")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

setKey.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getKey key}. Unique key of the Chart scheme When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sKey: type: string, description: New value for property key

sap.gantt.config.ChartScheme.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
The ChartScheme control is one of the settings of {@link sap.gantt.GanttChart}.

A Gantt chart uses this setting to decide the mode of Gantt chart and the shapes to display in the Gantt chart. A Gantt chart contains one or more Chart schemes. By switching between these schemes, the Gantt chart can display different shapes.

getKey.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getKey key}.

Unique key of the Chart scheme

setRowSpan.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRowSpan rowSpan}. Decides the row height of {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartBase} For example, if rowSpan is 2, the row height of the Gantt chart equals twice of the row height of the tree table When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 1.

parameters.iRowSpan: type: int, description: New value for property rowSpan

sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new AdhocLine class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapChart_Sequence_3_BorderColor")
    • {@link #get_strokeWidth _strokeWidth} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStrokeDasharray strokeDasharray} : string
    • {@link #getStrokeOpacity strokeOpacity} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getTimeStamp timeStamp} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMarkerType markerType} : sap.gantt.simple.MarkerType (default: None)
    • {@link #getMarkerPopoverDelay markerPopoverDelay} : int (default: 300)
    • {@link #get_selected _selected} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_level _level} : int (default: 1)
    • {@link #getDraggable draggable} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Events
    • {@link #event:markerPress markerPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:markerMouseEnter markerMouseEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:markerMouseLeave markerMouseLeave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:adhoclineDrop adhoclineDrop} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

parameters.fStrokeOpacity: type: float, description: New value for property strokeOpacity

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine itself. Fires when the adhoc marker is pressed.
attachMarkerPress.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine

parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

setStroke.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStroke stroke}. Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. You can provide the stroke attribute with HTML colors and the URL reference to the paint server. Paint server definitions usually come from paint servers rendered by {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_3_BorderColor".

parameters.sStroke: type: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer, description: New value for property stroke

x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time as a base.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

sap.gantt.shape.Rectangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Rectangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: "rect")
    • {@link #getIsDuration isDuration} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getWidth width} : float
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 15)
    • {@link #getRx rx} : string (default: "0")
    • {@link #getRy ry} : string (default: "0")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.

getY.!description:
Gets the value of property y.

y coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter oRowInfo as a base and uses property height as an offset to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and the row data.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseTriangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new BaseTriangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getStroke stroke} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
    • {@link #getStrokeWidth strokeWidth} : float (default: 1)
    • {@link #getStrokeDasharray strokeDasharray} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: 0)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: 0)
    • {@link #getOrientation orientation} : string (default: "right")
  • Events
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseEnter mouseEnter} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:mouseLeave mouseLeave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle} can be used as well.

getWidth.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}. The horizontal width of a shape. Auto will be converted to width calculated from time and endTime. Default value is "auto".

getHeight.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. Height defines the vertical length of the shape. By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height. Default value is "auto".

sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Shape class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getColor color} : sap.gantt.PaletteColor (default: "sapUiLegend6")
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: "auto")
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: "auto")
    • {@link #getStartX startX} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: "auto")
    • {@link #getSelectable selectable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHoverable hoverable} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

renderContent.!description: Renders the content of the shape.

getSelectable.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.71.2 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} The property and its default value, that is set to 'false', are being inherited from the parent BaseShape.
Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectable selectable}. All standard shapes are selectable. Default value is true.

sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.!description:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.

setStartX.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getStartX startX}. The x position of the shapes start. Auto will be converted to position based on time. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "auto".

parameters.sStartX: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property startX

getXStart.!description: Computes the x coordinate of the shape beginning.

getColor.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getColor color}. Color to be used for rendering the shape. Default value is "sapUiLegend6".

getHoverable.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.71.2 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} The property and its default value, that is set to 'false', are being inherited from the parent BaseShape.
Gets current value of property {@link #getHoverable hoverable}. All standard shapes are hoverable. Default value is true.

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. Height defines the vertical length of the shape. By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "auto".

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property height

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. The horizontal width of a shape. Auto will be converted to width calculated from time and endTime. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "auto".

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property width

setSelectable.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.71.2 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} The property and its default value, that is set to 'false', are being inherited from the parent BaseShape.
Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectable selectable}. All standard shapes are selectable. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bSelectable: type: boolean, description: New value for property selectable

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getHoverColor.!description: Returns hex color for hover stroke.

setColor.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getColor color}. Color to be used for rendering the shape. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapUiLegend6".

parameters.sColor: type: sap.gantt.PaletteColor, description: New value for property color

sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape.!helpDescription:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

getSelectedColor.!description: Returns hex color for selected shapes.

getXEnd.!description: Computes the x coordinate of the shape end.

zoomLevel.!description: Zoom level of all gantt chart instances in GanttChartContainer

statusBarTimePattern.!description: Determines the time pattern set on the status bar.

rowHighlightFill.!description: The rowHighlightFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

selectedStrokeWidth.!description: Defines the stroke width when Relationship is selected

asyncMode.!description: Defines whether the OverflowToolbar works in async mode. Note: When this property is set to true, the OverflowToolbar makes its layout recalculations asynchronously. This way it is not blocking the thread immediately after re-rendering or resizing. However, it may lead to flickering, when there is a change in the width of the content of the OverflowToolbar.

showLegendButton.!description: Flag to show or hide legend button

hideSettingsItem.!description: Defines the list of items to be hidden in Settings.

supply.!description: The resource supply capacity, it's only used for UtilizationBarChart

calendarName.!description: Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions.

eventState.!description: This property defines the event for which the style should be applied. This is a mandatory field. For example, if the eventState is "dragDrop", the style is applied to ghost image of shape on drag.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

datePattern.!description: Specifies how the application's date is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "dd.MM.yyyy" (31.01.2018)

shapeMouseLeaveDelay.!description: Time in milliseconds where the mouse has moved out of the hovered shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseLeave event

yBias.!description: Y offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, it means translate the visual object to the bottom in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

timeDelay.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.97 Note:With the new implementation, this property won't have any effect.
Visibility of the Delta Line

useParentShapeOnExpand.!description: Determines if only tasks need to be used for rendering the expanded shapes. Subtasks are not required.

enableVerticalLine.!description: Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

verticalTextAlignment.!description: Vertical alignment for the title of the Shape.

_lMarker.!description: _lMarker determines up/down relation of L type .

active.!description: Indicates that the whole toolbar is clickable. The Press event is fired only if Active is set to true. Note: This property should be used when there are no interactive controls inside the toolbar and the toolbar itself is meant to be interactive.

enableAutoSelectOnFind.!description: This property enables the auto selection of a shape upon search and find.

demand.!description: The required/demand capacity, it's only used for used for UtilizationBarChart

showSearchSidePanel.!description: Flag to enable and disable search side panel.

customSearchResults.!description: Array of search results displayed on the toolbar and side panel

showMiddleLine.!description: Flag to show or hide the middle line in Utilization Line Chart. The value of the overConsumptionMargin will affect the middle line position. By default the middle line is a gray dashed line

stepCountOfSlider.!description:
Step count of {@link sap.m.Slider} This property only relevant if zoomControlType are:
  • SliderWithButtons
  • SliderOnly

alignCustomContentToRight.!description:
Defines how the toolbar custom content is aligned.
If set to true, the custom content in the toolbar is right-aligned. If set to false, it's left-aligned.
If a {@link sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbarPlaceholder} with a Spacer type is used in the content aggregation, the alignment of the content depends on this spacer.

_isAppRunningInRTA.!description: Flag to indicate if the app is running in Runtime Adaptation (RTA) mode.

lShapeForTypeSF.!description: Flag to change shape from L-shaped lines to S-shaped lines for start-to-finish relationship type

zoomControlType.!description: Defines the control type to set the zoom rate.

scheme.!description: Scheme key of the shape. The scheme is used by expand/collapse the main row shape. You can define the scheme together with shapeSchemes in sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the value defines here needse matchs the key value defines in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme

shapeClass.!description: Specifies the shape class name of dimension legend row It's a full shape module name

rx.!description: rx defines a radius on the x-axis.

ghostAlignment.!description: The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

ry.!description: ry defines a radius on the y-axis.

styleName.!description: Provides the style class name for the shape that can be mapped from shapeStyles aggregation in GanttChartWithTable or GanttChartContainer.

predecessor.!description: predecessor of the Relationship This property specify where the relationship starts, Relationship lookup the shape instance based on the property value

draggable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is draggable a draggble shape requires the shape is selectable set true as well.

shapeTypeStart.!description: Defines the shape at the start of a relationship

shapeRenderOrder.!description: Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top

selectedStroke.!description: Defines the stroke color when Relationship is selected

tailWidth.!description: The tail width of the Chevron

d.!description: The d property provides a path definition to be drawn.

snapMode.!description: Enables snapping of shapes to attach to the nearest visual element while dragging.

_shapeCropped.!description: property to check if shape is cropped by the visible horizon

x.!description: x defines a x-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system

enableStatusBar.!description: Flag to enable and disable status bar.

y.!description: defines a y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system

endTime.!description: End time of the shape. This property is mandatory if the shape is a duration shape. You must bind this property to a model, or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The duration is determined by minusing the value of property time

opacity.!description:
The opacity attribute specifies the transparency of an object or of a group of objects, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

The minimum value is 0.0 and maximum value is 1.0

selectedEndShapeColor.!description: Defines the color of the shape at the end of the selected relationship

printingBatchSize.!description: Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing.

isThreshold.!description: checks if the dimension is a threshold line.

lShapeForTypeFS.!description: Flag to change shape from L-shaped lines to S-shaped lines for finish-to-start relationship type

enableExpandedRowBorders.!description: Property to enable borders for expanded rows. By default, only row borders are enabled.

shapeMouseEnterDelay.!description: Time in milliseconds where the mouse has to be on the same shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseEnter event

enableCurvedEdge.!description: Flag to enable or disable rounded corners on relationship

selectionPanelSize.!description: The width of selection panel. In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

remainCapacityColorNegative.!description: Sets the remaining capacity color for negative values

infoOfSelectItems.!description:
Array of plain objects that have "key" and "text" properties, or array of sap.ui.core.Item used to configure the items in the {@link sap.m.Select} control

This property is only works if the zoomControlType is Select

overConsumptionMargin.!description: Defines the margin height of UtilizationChart

showTimeZoomControl.!description: Flag to show or hide zoom buttons

enablePseudoShapes.!description: Optimizes the rendering of overlapping shapes

showEllipsis.!description: Flag to show the ellipsis symbol.

enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight.!description: Flag to show or hide Chart Delta Area highlighting

activeShape.!description: Defines which shape from the shapes aggregation is visible. If you specify a negative value or a value that is greater than the number of shapes defined, no shape will be rendered.

enableChartOverflowToolbar.!description: Option to show or hide the chart overflow toolbar.

overConsumptionColor.!description: Defines the over comsumption color, or fill pattern.

showSettingButton.!description: Flag to show or hide setting button

relationshipOverDivider.!description: Flag to have relationship pass over divider line

selectOnlyGraphicalShape.!description: Enables selection of only graphical shapes excluding labels.

deltaAreaHighlightColor.!description: Property to add custom color to the highlighted area between delta lines. This would default to Fiori standard color

_show.!description: Shows or hides the represented control.

shapeHighlightSettings.!description:
A JSON object containing the shapeHighlightSettings that is used to configure shape highlight styles. If nothing is specified, then the default highlight styles (2px dashed black border) is set. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

showParentRowOnExpand.!description: Option to show or hide the parent row on expand. This is applicable only for multi-activity row settings.

showTitle.!description: Flag to show or hide the title of the Shape.

_level.!description: Level of markers in the header.

nowLineInUTC.!description: Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in FLP time.

name.!description: The name of the utilization dimension, e.g. Total Weight

x1.!description: x1 defines the x-axis coordinate of the line starting point

enableChainSelection.!description: Enables selection of all shapes that are part of a shape chain in a Gantt chart

x2.!description: x2 defines the x-axis coordinate of the line ending point

alignShape.!description: Enables alignment of the shape. The shape can be aligned to the top, middle or bottom. By default, this property is set to Middle. Note: Alignment is not possible for BaseLine and BasePath. It will be set to BaseChevron, BaseRectangle, BaseCursor BaseDiamond, BaseText, BaseTriangle and BaseGroup.

optimiseRelationships.!description: Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default.

strokeWidth.!description: The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

dragHighlightRows.!description: Comma-separated value of row IDs for the rows that are highlighted when the shape is being dragged. The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed.

timePattern.!description: Specifies how the application's time is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "hh:mm a" (12:05 PM)

shapeSelectionSettings.!description:
A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. New properties 'shapeColor' and 'fillOpacity' are introduced as of SAPUI5 1.85 release. Using these, you can configure color and opacity of highlighted shapes in a gantt chart. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

enableMultipleGhosts.!description: Flag to enable displaying multiple ghosts when multiple shapes are selected and dragged.

isConnectorDetailsVisible.!description: Defines whether shapeConnectorList is displayed upon the click of connector/relationship or not

y1.!description: y1 defines the y-axis coordinate of the line starting point

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

y2.!description: y2 defines the y-axis coordinate of the line ending point

disableShapeDoubleClickEvent.!description: Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

rowSpan.!description: row span of the shape scheme. If the shape scheme is not a primary scheme, you need to define how many rows (rowSpan) the expanded shape will take when rendering

isLabel.!description: Flag to consider a baseText as not a part of graphical shape. Label exclusion is only applicable to outermost basegroup.

length.!description: The horizontal length of a cursor. This property influences generated value d.

enableChartSelectionState.!description: Option to disable or enable the chart row's selection state.

stroke.!description: The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape;

deltaLineLayer.!description: Specifies the layer on which Delta Lines reside. By default, Delta Lines are above all shapes and patterns.

shapeId.!description: ID of the shape. shapeId property represents a unique identifier for a business object. This property shall be bound to a property during initialization, it requires an unique non-empty value.

time.!description: Start time of the shape. This property is mandatory. You must bind this property to a model, or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The value will be converted to x coordination when rendering. If not set, the shape is not visible.

snapTimeInterval.!description: Defines the least time taken in seconds for a shape to snap while in a particular zoom level. eg. { "4hour":{timeInterval:1800}, ---> 30mins Snap "1hour":{timeInterval:900} ---> 15mins Snap }

truncateWidth.!description: The width to start truncate the text. If the value is omit, the text is truncated base on it's parent width

enableDeltaLine.!description: Flag to show or hide Delta Lines

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

interactive.!description: Indicates whether the check box is visible or not.

textAnchor.!description: This property is used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point

enableLassoInvert.!description: Enables inversion on shape selection while drawing lasso

enableExpandedRowBackground.!description: Property to enable the background color for expanded rows. By default, this would show the row background

relativePoint.!description: Sets the relative point to start the dimensions

countInBirdEye.!description: Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account when performing a bird eye zooming. We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered into bird eye range.

startShapeColor.!description: Defines the color of the shape at the start of a relationship

_isSelected.!description: Selection property of the Delta Markers

enableNowLine.!description: Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

selectedTitleColor.!description: The selectedTitleColor property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape's title when it is selected.

displayType.!description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}.

enableSelectAndDrag.!description: Allows to drag, drop, and resize a shape on explicitly selecting the shape.

enableAutoFocusOnZoom.!description: This property enables auto focus while zooming in on a selected shape.

fontSize.!description: The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

style.!description: Defines the visual style of the Toolbar. Note: The visual styles are theme-dependent.

endShapeColor.!description: Defines the color of the shape at the end of a relationship

primary.!description: Whether the scheme apply on the shapes on the main row

successor.!description: successor of the Relationship This property specify where the relationship ends, Relationship lookup the shape instance by the property value.

headWidth.!description: The head width of the Chevron

rowHighlightAndHoverFill.!description: The rowHighlightAndHoverFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted and hovered rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

horizontalLazyLoadingEnabled.!description: Set to true if Gantt chart is configured to be lazy loaded horizontally. Application should fetch the data only for the visible horizon. Application also should make sure to fetch the relevant data on user interactions like horizontal scroll, zoom out, bird eye which changes the visible horizon until the time when all the data is fetched. This property has to be used with setAllDataLoadedPromise().

fillFactory.!description: Factory function is used to determine the fill property for different shape classes defined in yDimension config. Shape name of the shape class is passed as a parameter to the function. The return value should be a color code.

horizontalTextAlignment.!description: Horizontal alignment for the title of the Shape.

enabled.!description: Sets the enabled property of all controls defined in the content aggregation. Note: This property does not apply to the toolbar itself, but rather to its items.

statusBarDatePattern.!description: Determines the date pattern set on the status bar.

enableAdhocLine.!description: Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

showShapeTimeOnDrag.!description: Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line. The property takes effect if only one shape is selected or enableMultipleGhosts is set to false.

titleColor.!description: The titleColor property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape title;

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

showSearchButton.!description: Flag to show or hide Find and Select search button Find operation is not going to work for the stock chart and utilization gantt charts with time continuous shapes.

endTimeStamp.!description: End time stamp of the Delta Line

titleSpacing.!description: The titleSpacing property defines the space between the start of the shape and the shape title in pixels

strokeDasharray.!description: The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

resizable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is resizable. Resizing a shape requires the shape is selectable as well.

showGanttHeader.!description: Option to show or hide the header of the Gantt chart

statusMessage.!description: Defines the message texts set on the status bar.

filter.!description: The filter property defines the filter effects defined by the <filter> element that shall be applied to its element

timeStamp.!description: Start time stamp of the Delta Line

visibleDeltaStartEndLines.!description: Visibility of the Delta Start and End Lines

enableCursorLine.!description: Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

showAnimation.!description: Flag to show or hide animation of an active shape.

width.!description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

findMode.!description: Defines where the search box should appear on pressing the find button

selectedStartShapeColor.!description: Defines the color of the shape at the start of the selected relationship

pointHeight.!description: The point size of a cursor. This property influences generated value d.

connectable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is connectable. When this property is set to true, you can connect two different shapes to create a relationship

showDisplayTypeButton.!description: Flag to show or hide display type menu on the toolbar

enableTimeScrollSync.!description: Flag to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

rightAnchorPosition.!description: Postion of right anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

shapeName.!description: Specifies the name of the dimension legend row

layoutOrientation.!description: The GanttChartContainer use Splitter to manager the layout, it can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Note: the property only take effect if GanttChartContainer has more than 1 ganttChart instances

fontFamily.!description: This property indicates the font family that gets used to render the text in the shape.

enableChartHoverState.!description: Option to disable or enable the chart row's hover state.

fontWeight.!description: The fontWeight property refers to the font weight that gets used to render the text in the shape.

findByOperator.!description: Defines relationship between the operator and the property names using the findAll method

fill.!description:
The fill property enables you to define the fill color for shapes and texts.

For shapes and text the fill property is a presentation attribute that lets define the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns)

markerPopoverDelay.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.97 Note:With the new implementation, this property won't have any effect.
Delay in milliseconds for the marker popover to show up

consumptionColor.!description: The color fills in capacity consumption

enableNonWorkingTime.!description: Flag to show or hide non-working time

selectableInChainSelection.!description: Enables selection of a shape when it is part of the shape chain. By default, this property is set as True.

animationSettings.!description:
animationSettings - A JSON object used to apply animation to the color of the specified shape.
  • "values": null - A list of values defining the sequence of colors appearing during animation.
  • "duration": "1s" - Denotes the duration of the animation. The value must be greater than 0, and can be expressed in hours(h), minutes(m), seconds(s), or milliseconds(ms).
  • "repeatCount": "indefinite" - Denotes the number of times an animation repeats.
Restriction: Enter at least two colors in the values key for the animation to work. If duration and repeatCount are unspecified, the default values (duration '1s' and repeatCount 'indefinite') are set. Note: This is only applicable for animation of shapes in Gantt charts. This is not applicable for utilization charts. Refer to an example below: 

{
	  "values": "sapContent_Selected_ForegroundColor;sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor",
	  "duration": "1s",
	  "repeatCount": "indefinite"
}

fillOpacity.!description: The fillOpacity property is a presentation property defining the opacity of the paint server (color, gradient, pattern, etc) applied to a shape.

ariaHasPopup.!description:
Defines the aria-haspopup attribute of the Toolbar. if the active design is true. Guidance for choosing appropriate value:
  • We recommend that you use the {@link sap.ui.core.aria.HasPopup} enumeration.
  • If you use controls based on sap.m.Popover or sap.m.Dialog, then you must use AriaHasPopup.Dialog (both sap.m.Popover and sap.m.Dialog have role "dialog" assigned internally).
  • If you use other controls, or directly sap.ui.core.Popup, you need to check the container role/type and map the value of ariaHasPopup accordingly.

_xBiassed.!description: xBaised value to be added to cropped shape when horizontalTextAligment is set to "Dynamic"

adhocLineLayer.!description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

dragOrientation.!description:
Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

hoverable.!description: Specifies whether the shape is hoverable. hovering the mouse pointer over the shape fires the shapeMouseEnter event and moving the mouse pointer out of the shape fires the shapeMouseLeave event.

navigated.!description: The navigated state of a row. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the row. Note: This property must be set for one row only.

highlightText.!description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.ui.table.RowSettings#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes. It is only used as an invisible text for screen reader support and does not add a tooltip to the highlight.

showTextOnGhost.!description: Option to show or hide shape labels on ghost while dragging. The property takes effect only when enableMultipleGhosts is set to true.

shapeTypeEnd.!description: Defines the shape at the end of a relationship

expandedRowHeight.!description: Property to define the height of an expanded row in pixels. * @since 1.85

highlight.!description: The highlight state of the rows. If the highlight is set to {@link module:sap/ui/core/message/MessageType MessageType.None} (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link module:sap/ui/core/message/MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor} (only values of Indication01 to Indication10 are supported for accessibility contrast reasons). Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.ui.table.RowSettings#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link module:sap/ui/core/message/MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

transform.!description: The transform property defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children Right now in gantt library, only translate() method is supported. CSS methods like scale, skew, rotate and matrix doesn't support. And if you provide values for transform, the values will update xBias and yBias if translate the corresponding axis is matched.

busy.!description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

design.!description: Defines the toolbar design. Note: Design settings are theme-dependent. They also determine the default height of the toolbar.

selectedFill.!description: The selectedFill property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape when it is selected.

value.!description: The value of the actual consumption capacity. It's only relevant for UtilizationLineChart

src.!description: Src of the image. If the image is represented by an icon font, then the src is sap-icon://task for instance

shapeOverRelationship.!description:
Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape.

If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes.

relationshipShapeSize.!description: Specifies the size of the relationship's shape. Applicable to triangles, square, diamond, and circle shapes; excluding horizontal rectangle and vertical rectangle shapes.

enableFlatLegends.!description: shows all the list legends in flat structure instead of navigation list. restriction - will work only with list legends.

xBias.!description: X offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, means to translate the visual object to the right in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

shapeSelectionMode.!description: Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed. The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

leftAnchorPosition.!description: Postion of left anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

showBirdEyeButton.!description: Flag to show or hide bird eye button on the toolbar

findBy.!description: Defines the property names for which findAll method should search in different entities

visible.!description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

blocked.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

busyIndicatorDelay.!description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busyIndicatorSize.!description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

fieldGroupIds.!description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateTyp.!description: This type specifies the reason why visible horizon is changing.

ZoomLevelChanged.!description: The visible horizon is updated when the zoom level is changed, either by the user or the application.

InitialRender.!description: The visible horizon is updated when Gantt chart gets rendered (which is triggered by an onAfterRenderer event) and needs to set visible horizon based on the chart configuration.

SyncVisibleHorizon.!description: The update is triggered by the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. This update is used to keep all Gantt charts in one container in sync. When the user performs an action that changes the visible horizon, an event with the action type is fired on the original Gantt chart and SyncVisibleHorizon gets fired on all other Gantt charts in the container.

TimePeriodZooming.!description: An update happens when the user selects a time period using the Z key + mouse.

TotalHorizonUpdated.!description: The visible horizon is updated when the total horizon of a Gantt chart changes or is set. Changes in total horizon may affect the visible horizon as well.

HorizontalScroll.!description: The visible horizon is updated when a user scrolls using the Gantt chart horizontal scroll bar.

MouseWheelZoom.!description: The update is triggered by the user scrolling horizontally with a mouse wheel (Ctrl + Shift + mouse wheel).

sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbarPlaceho.!description: Toolbar placeholders for a Gantt chart container.

Spacer.!description: A toolbar spacer that can be used between buttons.

sap.gantt.config.ObjectType.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new object type Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string
    • {@link #getMainChartSchemeKey mainChartSchemeKey} : string (default: sap.gantt.config.DEFAULT_MAIN_CHART_SCHEME_KEY)
    • {@link #getExpandedChartSchemeKeys expandedChartSchemeKeys} : string[] (default: [])
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.simple.GanttRowSettings.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new GanttRowSettings class Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getRowId rowId} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCalendars calendars} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getCalendars1 calendars1} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getCalendars2 calendars2} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getCalendars3 calendars3} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getCalendars4 calendars4} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getCalendars5 calendars5} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar[]
    • {@link #getRelationships relationships} : sap.gantt.simple.Relationship[]
    • {@link #getShapes1 shapes1} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape[] (default)
    • {@link #getShapes2 shapes2} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape[]
    • {@link #getShapes3 shapes3} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape[]
    • {@link #getShapes4 shapes4} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape[]
    • {@link #getShapes5 shapes5} : sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape[]
    • {@link #getOverlays1 overlays1} : sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay[]
    • {@link #getOverlays2 overlays2} : sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay[]
    • {@link #getOverlays3 overlays3} : sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay[]
    • {@link #getOverlays4 overlays4} : sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay[]
    • {@link #getOverlays5 overlays5} : sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.table.RowSettings#constructor sap.ui.table.RowSettings} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseTriangle}.
Triangle shape class using SVG tag 'path'. It's usually treated as a transient shape.

The following image shows how the properties are designed:

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle.

setDistanceOfyAxisHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getDistanceOfyAxisHeight distanceOfyAxisHeight}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 5.

parameters.fDistanceOfyAxisHeight: type: float, description: New value for property distanceOfyAxisHeight

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 10.

parameters.fHeight: type: float, description: New value for property height

setIsClosed.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getIsClosed isClosed}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

parameters.bIsClosed: type: boolean, description: New value for property isClosed

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.gantt.shape.Path.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

getHeight.!description:
Gets the value of property height.

Height of a triangle. This property influences property d.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.shape.ext.Triangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Triangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIsClosed isClosed} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBase base} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : float (default: 10)
    • {@link #getDistanceOfyAxisHeight distanceOfyAxisHeight} : float (default: 5)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Path#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Path} can be used as well.

Base side of a triangle. This property influences property d.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

getDistanceOfyAxisHeight.!description:
Gets the value of property distanceOfyAxisHeight.

distanceOfyAxisHeight of a triangle, which refers to the distance between the left point to the altitude of the triangle. This property influences property d.

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

parameters.fBase: type: float, description: New value for property base

getD.!description:
Gets the value of property d.

d attribute of path element. Your application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of d by using properties time, base, height, and distanceOfyAxisHeight. The value of these properties can be retrieved from the corresponding getters (getTime, getBase, getHeight, and getDistanceOfyAxisHeight).

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.def.gradient.LinearGradient.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a linear gradient defined for later reuse. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getX1 x1} : string (default: "0")
    • {@link #getY1 y1} : string (default: "0")
    • {@link #getX2 x2} : string (default: "100")
    • {@link #getY2 y2} : string (default: "15")
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getStops stops} : sap.gantt.def.gradient.Stop[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.def.DefBase#constructor sap.gantt.def.DefBase} can be used as well.

Gets content of aggregation {@link #getStops stops}.

'stop' elements in the 'linearGradient' element.

Table.!description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays only a table.

Both.!description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays both a table and a chart.

Chart.!description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays only a chart.

sap.gantt.config.ZoomControlType.!description: Define the type of zoom control in global tool bar

SliderWithButtons.!description: Uses the SliderWithButtons control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderWithButtons control consists of zoom in and zoom out magnifier buttons and a slider.

SliderOnly.!description: Uses the SliderOnly control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderOnly control only consists of a slider.

Select.!description: Uses the Select control to modify the time zoom rate. The Select control consists of a drop down list to select a suitable zoom rate.

ButtonsOnly.!description: Uses the ButtonsOnly control to modify the time zoom rate. The SliderOnly control only consists of zoom in and zoom out buttons.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new BaseText class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getX x} : float
    • {@link #getY y} : float
    • {@link #getFontSize fontSize} : int (default: 13)
    • {@link #getTextAnchor textAnchor} : string (default: "start")
    • {@link #getFontFamily fontFamily} : string (default: "sapFontFamily")
    • {@link #getTruncateWidth truncateWidth} : float
    • {@link #getShowEllipsis showEllipsis} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getIsLabel isLabel} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_shapeCropped _shapeCropped} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #get_xBiassed _xBiassed} : float
    • {@link #getFill fill} : sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer (default: "sapTextColor")
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

getTruncateWidth.!description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, specifies a truncate width. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated automatically. This method will return the minimum between property truncateWidth and it's parent's width caculated by time range.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseText.!description: BaseText defines a graphics element consisting of text.

This property indicates which font family will be used to render the text, specified as a prioritized list of font family names and/or generic family names When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "sapFontFamily".

parameters.sFontFamily: type: string, description: New value for property fontFamily

getX.!description:
Gets current value of property x.

x coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time from itself or it's parent that has method getTime. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

getY.!description:
Gets current value of property y.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter RowYCenter and property fontSize to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
Base class for all SVG definitions. It is different from the svgDefs in GanttChartBase. It is a container shape and related to shape data.

SVG uses the 'defs' tag to represent graphic objects that can be reused at a later time. Currently sap.gantt provides defs like TextRepeat. Applications can also extend this base class to support more functionality.

sap.gantt.shape.Definitions.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new SVG graphic object according to shape data. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTag tag} : string (default: "defs")
    • {@link #getChildTagName childTagName} : string
    • {@link #getContent content} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getReferenceId referenceId} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Shape#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Shape} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.shape.Definitions.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 the concept has been discarded.
Base class for all SVG definitions. It is different from the svgDefs in GanttChartBase. It is a container shape and related to shape data.

SVG uses the 'defs' tag to represent graphic objects that can be reused at a later time. Currently sap.gantt provides defs like TextRepeat. Applications can also extend this base class to support more functionality.

parameters.sTag: type: string, description: New value for property tag

getChildTagName.!description: Gets the value of the childTagName property. The 'defs' element is a container element for referenced elements. The content model for 'defs' is the same as that for the 'g' element; thus, any element that can be a child of a 'g' can also be a child of a 'defs'. The 'childTagName' is the name of any child element of 'defs'.

y coordinate of the image rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbar.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new ContainerToolbar class Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getShowBirdEyeButton showBirdEyeButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDisplayTypeButton showDisplayTypeButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowLegendButton showLegendButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSettingButton showSettingButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTimeZoomControl showTimeZoomControl} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getZoomControlType zoomControlType} : sap.gantt.config.ZoomControlType (default: SliderWithButtons)
    • {@link #getStepCountOfSlider stepCountOfSlider} : int (default: 10)
    • {@link #getInfoOfSelectItems infoOfSelectItems} : object[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getZoomLevel zoomLevel} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getAlignCustomContentToRight alignCustomContentToRight} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSearchButton showSearchButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFindMode findMode} : sap.gantt.config.FindMode (default: Both)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getSettingItems settingItems} : sap.gantt.config.SettingItem[]
    • {@link #getLegendContainer legendContainer} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:zoomStopChange zoomStopChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:birdEyeButtonPress birdEyeButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:displayTypeChange displayTypeChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:ganttSidePanel ganttSidePanel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:findButtonPress findButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closeFindButtonPress closeFindButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:findPopupButtonPress findPopupButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:closeSidePanelButtonPress closeSidePanelButtonPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.OverflowToolbar#constructor sap.m.OverflowToolbar} can be used as well.

Creates and initializes a new Diamond class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIsClosed isClosed} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getVerticalDiagonal verticalDiagonal} : float (default: 12)
    • {@link #getHorizontalDiagonal horizontalDiagonal} : float (default: 12)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.shape.Path#constructor sap.gantt.shape.Path} can be used as well.
sap.gantt.shape.ext.Diamond.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 replaced by {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseDiamong}.
Diamond shape class using SVG tag 'path'. It's usually treated as transient shape.

The following SVG image shows how the properties are designed:

getD.!description:
Gets the value of property d.

d attribute of the path element. You application should not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates value of d by using properties horizontalDiagonal and verticalDiagonal. The value of these properties can be retrieved using the corresponding getters (getHorizontalDiagonal and getVerticalDiagonal).

parameters.oRowInfo: type: object, description: Information about the row and row data.

sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend.!description:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure column to indicate object statuses and row to indicate object types. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and “Unplanned”. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Dimension Legend class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getColumnConfigs columnConfigs} : sap.gantt.simple.LegendColumnConfig[]
    • {@link #getRowConfigs rowConfigs} : sap.gantt.simple.LegendRowConfig[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.

getTitle.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}.

Title of Legend Page & text of navigation list item (if not set it will be empty)

sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend.!helpDescription:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure column to indicate object statuses and row to indicate object types. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and “Unplanned”. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

setHeight.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getHeight height}. height defines the vertical length of the rectangle. By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "auto".

parameters.sHeight: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property height

setRy.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getRy ry}. ry defines a radius on the y-axis. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 0.

parameters.sRy: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property ry

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. width defines the horizontal length of the rectangle. Most of time it's calculated by properties time and endTime automatically When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.gantt.SVGLength, description: New value for property width

getX.!description:

x coordinate of the top-left corner of the rectangle. Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time as a base.

sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new BaseRectangle class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties

    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: "auto")
    • {@link #getRx rx} : sap.gantt.SVGLength (default: 0)

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape#constructor sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape} can be used as well.

sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt Chart with a TreeTable control on the left and a svg chart area on the right. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getCellCallback cellCallback} : object
    • {@link #getFixedColumnCount fixedColumnCount} : int
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCustomToolbarItems customToolbarItems} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getColumns columns} : sap.ui.table.Column[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.gantt.GanttChartBase#constructor sap.gantt.GanttChartBase} can be used as well.

setCellCallback.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getCellCallback cellCallback}. A customized cell callback function.

This property is used in combination with configuration property hierarchies. If aggregation columns is provided, property hierarchies and cellCallback is ignored. Otherwise property hierarchies must provide column configurations that cellCallback can consume. And if cellCallback is not provided, a default cellCallback adds sap.m.Label to fill cells.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.oCellCallback: type: object, description: New value for property cellCallback

sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} should be used instead.
Embed a sap.ui.table.TreeTable and a sap.gantt.GanttChart side-by-side.

This class defines: The TreeTable part provide a column view of data with sorting/filtering functions available. The svg chart part provide graphic Gantt chart view of data. Both width can be adjusted by a splitter bar, and row scrolling are always synchronized.3

getCustomToolbarItems.!description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCustomToolbarItems customToolbarItems}. Controls to be place in Gantt chart toolbar.

This aggregation is only used when custom toolbar item group is configured to be shown in Gantt chart toolbar. Different from the build-in buttons which are configured to be shown or hidden, these are free controls created by application, only they are placed in container toolbar by sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.

A common recommendation is, if the source select group is enabled and application wants to pre-configure container layouts, the chance to change custom toolbar items is in event handler to event ganttChartSwitchRequested.

This property is used in combination with configuration property hierarchies. If aggregation columns is provided, property hierarchies and cellCallback is ignored. Otherwise property hierarchies must provide column configurations that cellCallback can consume. And if cellCallback is not provided, a default cellCallback adds sap.m.Label to fill cells.

sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable.!helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.64 {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} should be used instead.
Embed a sap.ui.table.TreeTable and a sap.gantt.GanttChart side-by-side.

This class defines: The TreeTable part provide a column view of data with sorting/filtering functions available. The svg chart part provide graphic Gantt chart view of data. Both width can be adjusted by a splitter bar, and row scrolling are always synchronized.3

sap.gantt.overlays.GanttRowOverlay.!constructorDescription:
Creates and initializes a new GanttRowOverlay class. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getStaticOverlay staticOverlay} : sap.gantt.overlays.Overlay[] (default)
    • {@link #getExpandedOverlay expandedOverlay} : sap.gantt.overlays.Overlay[]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

getShapeRenderOrder.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeRenderOrder shapeRenderOrder}. Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top Default value is [].
